Tools¶

class coop.tools.AStar(initial_state, goal_state, walls)[source]¶

An execution of the A* algorithm.

Parameters:
initial_state : (int, int)

This argument contains the coordinates of the initial node.

goal_state : (int, int)

This argument contains the coordinates of the goal node.

walls : list of (int, int)

This argument contains the list of all the obstacles to be avoided.
Attributes:
initial_state : Node

The initial node.

goal_state : Node

The goal node.

walls : list of (int, int)

The storage location of the walls position.

open_set : Heap

The fringe of the algorithm.

closed_set : list of Node

The list of nodes already extended during the execution.

Methods

add_to_open_set(states) Appends the given nodes to the fringe.
get_node_at(coordinates) Retrieves the node with the given coordinates in the closed set.
get_not_extended(states) Filters out already extended nodes from the given list of nodes.
get_reversed_step_sequence() Determines the steps leading to the goal from the initial state.
open_set_is_empty() Tests whether the fringe is empty.
run() Runs A* algorithm
select_best() Selects the best node in the fringe on the basis of its f-value.
set_new_goal(new_goal) Sets the new goal for the A* algorithm.
add_to_open_set(states)[source]¶

Appends the given nodes to the fringe.

Parameters:
states : list of Node

A list of state-wrapping nodes to be added to the fringe.
get_node_at(coordinates)[source]¶

Retrieves the node with the given coordinates in the closed set.

Parameters:
coordinates : (int, int)

The coordinates of the desired node.
Returns:
Node or None

The node in the closed set whose coordinates are given.
get_not_extended(states)[source]¶

Filters out already extended nodes from the given list of nodes.

Parameters:
states : list[Node]

A list of state-wrapping nodes.
Returns:
list of Node

The list obtained as a result of removing already extended nodes from the given list.
get_reversed_step_sequence()[source]¶

Determines the steps leading to the goal from the initial state.

Returns:
list of (int, int)

The step sequence to take to get to the goal state from the initial state.

Notes

The returned step sequence was built as a stack so the agent must use pop() in order to obtain the immediate next step to take.

open_set_is_empty()[source]¶

Tests whether the fringe is empty.

Returns:
bool

True iff the fringe is empty.
run()[source]¶

Runs A* algorithm

Returns:
list of (int, int)

The reversed list of steps to take to get to the goal state from the initial state.
select_best()[source]¶

Selects the best node in the fringe on the basis of its f-value.

Returns:
Node

The node of the fringe with the lowest f-value.
set_new_goal(new_goal)[source]¶

Sets the new goal for the A* algorithm.

Parameters:
new_goal : (int, int)

The coordinates of a new goal to meet.
class coop.tools.Heap(elements=[])[source]¶

A priority queue assuring unicity.

Parameters:
elements : list of comparable object, optional

This argument is used to initialise the heap.

Notes

This priority queue implementation uses a list as the container of the elements, which have to implement at least one greatness comparison function.

Attributes:
size

The size of the heap

Methods

is_empty() Test emptyness.
push(el) Add an element.
pop() Remove the element with the highest priority.
push(el)[source]¶

unicity

size¶

The size of the heap

class coop.tools.Node(a_star, x, y, parent=None)[source]¶

A node in A* algorithm’s state graph.

Parameters:
a_star : AStar

This argument points to the A* instance that created this node.

x : int

This argument contains the row number of this node.

y : int

This argument contains the column number of this node.

parent : Node, optional

This keyword argument points to the node preceding this node in a_star.
Attributes:
coordinates

The coordinates of the node

a_star : AStar

The storage location of the associated A* instance.

x : int

The storage location of the node’s row number.

y : int

The storage location of the node’s column number.

parent : Node

The storage location of the node’s parent.

cost : int

The cost of the path from A*’s root to this node.

NB_ROWS : int

The number of rows of the grid

NB_COLUMNS : int

The number of columns of the grid

Methods

distance(other) Calculates the distance between this node and the given one.
f() Calculates the f-value of this node.
get_step() Determines the step taken to come to this node from its parent.
get_valid_neighbours() Finds all the valid neighbours of this node.
h() Calculates the Manhattan heuristic value for this node.
has_parent() Tests whether this node has a parent.
is_valid(x, y) Tests whether the given position is in the grid bounds.
set_parent(parent) Changes the parent of this node.
set_world_dimensions(nb_rows, nb_columns) Sets the dimensions of the grid.
coordinates¶

The coordinates of the node

Returns:
int

the row number of this node

int

the column number of this node
distance(other)[source]¶

Calculates the distance between this node and the given one.

Parameters:
other : Node

The node for which the distance will be calculated.
Returns:
int

The distance between the two nodes.

See also

distance

f()[source]¶

Calculates the f-value of this node.

The f-value of a node corresponds to an estimate of the full path starting from the root and ending at the goal.

Returns:
int

The f-value of this node.
get_step()[source]¶

Determines the step taken to come to this node from its parent.

Returns:
int

The step taken along the column axis.

int

The step taken along the row axis.
get_valid_neighbours()[source]¶

Finds all the valid neighbours of this node.

A node is said to be valid if it does not enclose a wall and is located inside the grid.

Returns:
list of Node

The list of all this node’s valid neighbours.
h()[source]¶

Calculates the Manhattan heuristic value for this node.

It corresponds to an estimate of the cheapest path from this node to the goal.

Returns:
int

The heuristic value for this node.
has_parent()[source]¶

Tests whether this node has a parent.

Returns:
bool

True iff this node has a parent node assigned to it.

Parameters:

The row number.

y : int

The column number.
Returns:

True iff the given position is located inside the grid.

Sets the dimensions of the grid.

Parameters:
nb_rows : int

The number of rows.

nb_columns : int

The number of columns.

Calculates the Manhattan distance between the given points.

Parameters:

The coordinates of the first point.

other : tuple of int

Returns:
